description: This is a gem in Pacific Heights. Whenever I dine here, I feel like they treat me like family. The sushi is delicious and the service is friendly. It's a lovely, calm respite (with yummy sushi) from the craziness in the City.
author: Ashley S.

description:
I would give "ZERO" Stars, if I could, but Yelp, will only let me give a 1star as the lowest.

Last nite, I ordered my food, for dinner.  I literally, waited 25 minutes and got nothing. The guy told me, it would be at least another 30 minute wait.

If, I wasn't craving for Japanese Food, I would have gone somewhere else to eat.

2 hours later, I called to find out. If my Dinner is finally ready, and the guy said, it will be another 15 minutes wait.

WHAT ? ? ? 

By the time, I picked it up, it was actually 3 hours later!!!  THE FOOD WAS NOT HOT AND THE TASTE WAS NOT EVEN ALL THAT!!!

What a waste of my time and money! 

NEVER AGAIN, WILL I GO TO THIS RESTAURANT
author: Michelle Y.

description:
I was helping a family member who was in the hospital and wanted to get dinner.  I wandered down to Fillmore and found this place.

The good news:  The place is clean, well light and the service was friendly.

The bad news is that this place was really spendy, even for sushi in San Francisco.

I got a tempura roll (which was small for a roll), two orders (two pieces each) of nigiri (tuna and octopus) and one draft beer (16 ounces).  

The food was good (not great but good) but my check was almost $40 before tax.  I guess the tuna nigiri was $11 for two pieces.

You can get much better for a lot less.
author: Gary A.

description:
Service and atmosphere was fine. However, the food was not that great. 

Ordered the fried calamari and kimchi brussel sprouts as appetizers. Neither were exceptionally good. They were both luke warm. 

The sushi was a rip off. Each roll comes with four pieces. They were not put together well. The sticky rice was pretty soggy and a paste-like texture. The flavors of the five different rolls were pretty similar. We were concerned about the beige coloring of the fish. 

The rolls that should be hot were room temperature, and the rolls that should be chilled were room temperature. 

Really wanted to like this place, but it was not a keeper.
author: Matt S.

description:
I really wanted to like Ten-Ichi but I am not a fan. 

I stopped in on a recent Friday night and despite other sushi places being at capacity, Ten-Ichi was empty. That was the first red flag. After being seated, nobody came to take our order. I had to walk over and ask if we could order after we had been seated for 10-15 minutes. While our soups/drinks came pretty quickly, nobody came by to refill our waters until halfway through the dinner. Additionally, we had to ask twice if our food was coming because we didn't have it 30 minutes after ordering (despite there being only four other people in the restaurant). The food was okay but it took WAY too long to prepare and the service was horrible. I will sadly not be returning.
author: Katie C.

description:
why are there so many italian renaissance paintings of trees whose branches are ripe with sushi?

i learned in art history this is because the noble family of catherine de TEN-ICHI grew so famous that sushi became colloquially associated with their name. certain types of fish were even referred to as "tenichinal apples".

so the italian side of me didn't mind when a woman randomly brought me here. she wasn't italian though. so she wasn't aware of the paintings.

(^_^) Ama Ebi
crispy heads creamy bodies #twss

(^_^) Clay Roll
you had me at eel crab avocado

(^_^) Chicken Karaage
simple n good. classic

(-_^) Salmon Poke
w small cucumba slices ok

even though fillmore st proper is a huge ritzy shopping aisle, atmos was decidedly neighborhood casual. chinchillaxed. i didn't even care that the app was the last dish brought out.

NOTE: don't trip that i don't have any photos bijz. i don't think she was a yelper n i was being a ffffin gentleman by not having my phone out lol
author: Dan B.

description:
Very upsetting experience!!! This restaurant used to be reasonably good -- solid food,  friendly service, and with fair prices relative to the upscale neighborhood. I had been going there frequently for 15 years between the mid-1990's and 2011 and would have given it 3 or 4 stars. 

Fast forward to today. I just went back for the first time in years and was very negatively surprised by the poor service, marginal food, and high prices.  Sadly, this was probably the worst restaurant experience I have ever had in SF! I truly hope the restaurant will either get it's act together, as there are few sushi choices in Pac heights, or shut down, to save others from such a bad experience!
author: Richard F.

description:
While the fish was good, overall a mediocre experience, and likely won't bother returning. I got a bad vibe immediately after walking in, as the maitre d' counter is at the back of the restaurant near the sushi bar, leaving people confused when they come in. While the restaurant was mostly full, there were maybe two wait staff for the entire place and after they seated me I sat for 10 minutes without seeing one.

Our waitress was befuddled by my friend's honestly normal questions about sushi, such as which fishes were the freshest. Additionally, as some fish had multiple origins, the waitress should be able to address questions regarding the multiple types. Also, I'm guessing she was unfamiliar with sushi because when asked what the best order to eat them was, the answer was "whatever order you want". 

The first 2-3 pages of the menu are devoted to non-sushi dishes so I'd say this place is likely more of a teriyaki or udon noodle place pretending to be a high end sushi restaurant. You can do a lot better for the same price.
author: Jordan C.

description:
Came here with a friend who has been here before.  She ordered for us and I -- pretty much asked for whatever the chef was feeling.  We each had 4 pieces of sashimi and shared a roll.  One of the sashimi cuts was toro and I can say with confidence that was the best piece of raw fish I've ever tasted. Everything was also absolutely amazing.  We had sake that complimented  the meal very nicely.  It was all so good, that we ordered another roll and finished up with mango mochi ice cream. The mochi was delicious and soft.  Best sushi I've ever had.  Highly recommend. 

Ambiance: 5/5
Service: 5/5
Food and drink: 5/5
Overall Experience: 5/5
author: Elizabeth L.

description: Went here on a date and had high hopes for this part of the city, but quickly realized we should have just went to Japantown for more authentic Japanese food.  It was a Saturday evening, and the place was kind of busy.  The service was ok but the food was just alright.  I ordered a sushi roll and salmon don buri and my date ordered the ramen.  The ramen wasn't very flavorful and my don buri was kind of dry.  The sushi was flavorless.  Overall, I felt like the restaurant sucked the authenticity out of Japanese cuisine.
author: Ray P.

description: Ordered take out --- and it cost nearly $90 and a few items had to be tossed as they looked old and not edible. For instance the green salad had rotting  and browning lettuce and the salmon poke salad was almost $20 and was about 3 bites of food (not to mention was mediocre tasting and and did not look fresh). To top it all off, they included about a half a teaspoon of wasabi and a tablespoon of ginger (when I had asked for extra of both since the order was meant for 3 people). Again, for almost $90 of food, pretty unacceptable.
author: Alex V.

description: Came here for the first time with a few friends and it was DELISH! We started with the gyoza, and kimchi Brussel sprouts, both were really good. We then tried a few of the nigiri: sake, hamachi, maguro and one other and they were excellent!! It's definitely much more fresh than some other sushi places I've tried. We also had two of their special rolls which came in about 8-10 pieces each and those were very good. I will most definitely be back!
author: Ann B.

description: Gotta Go there! Neighborhood and city treasure, it has been in business over 40 years. Real subtle decor, but authentic! Clean as a whistle, and great menu and excellent staff.
author: Pat H.

description:
Love Ten-Ichi , been coming here for many years .
Dining in or to go , u cannot go wrong .
Tempura , chicken teriyaki & the chicken Kara -age 
Perfectly done , had this at two other restaurants recently in Japan Town , neither came close .
Sushi is fresh and perfect .
Same family has owned it for over 25 years .
Parking can be a challenge , but this restaurant is fantastic !!
author: Ellie O.

description: There's really no other way to say it except that the sushi is simply not fresh here.   Therefore there's just not that much taste. It's very bland so you need a lot of soy sauce...   And preparation is actually quite slow. I think they're in business because of the location, but there are so many other sushi choices in San Francisco that are fantastic so keep looking.
author: chris b.

description: My go-to Japanese restaurant in the area!  I have been enjoying this restaurant for over 15 years. Chicken Kara-Age has been my favorite, and I have never had the urge to try something different. Friendly, reasonable, consistent, and local.
author: The Elusive i.

description: I am one of those that uses yelp but never has written a review. But this place deserves to be acknowledged by a true sushi lover. From Nyc to La to SF there is no better Japenese menu then here. And the secret is to let them know all your favorite flavors and fish ...and how spicy or mild you want your order and let the sushi chefs behind the counter or the cooks in the kitchen do their thing. It's a magical food experience. Do not miss out on their fresh blue fin toro, in house-smoked salmon, Francine roll, spicy ramen, no name (w mango and shrimp) roll and there famous chicken and green bean sauté. It seems like the perfect place for a second or third date as you can sit at the sushi bar and see how adventurous your date actually is. After all Everyone deserves a Tenichi experience.
author: Danielle B.

description:
This place is fabulous! It is a highly recommend for sure! 
The homemade spicy ramen is delicious and 
The coconut curry shrimp is a must!
The servive is always awesome, 5 stars!
author: Jennifer B.

description: Had dinner there last week after a movie at the Clay. Wasn't busy when I got there at 6:30pm but quickly filled up. Service was fine and sushi good. I had a salmon skin roll, an eel roll and two orders of nigiri (mackerel and eel). Price was reasonable. I would definitely go back if I were in the neighborhood, though I wouldn't make a special trip to eat there.
author: Francoise F.

description: Love this place!  Their speciality rolls are perfection. The staff is especially warm and welcoming. This is a go-to place for repeat visits on a regular basis. Recently remodeled, great atmosphere where you can hear yourself talk, and especially good for after a movie at The Clay.
author: Kristine S.

description: This is one of my favorite Japanese restaurants in the city!! I love their curry rice and American Dream Roll!! Food is super fresh and the service is great!! High recommended!! Been here on a girls trip and on a romantic dinner and enjoyed every minute!!
author: Ula G.

description: Excellent sushi!  Native San Franciscan family owned and operated!  Steve has great customer service skills!  I'll definitely be going back!
author: Cooper J.

description: Great place for lunch. Service was attentive, food was flavorful. The Florence (?) role, with jalepeno was awesome. Miso was good too
author: Fred F.

description:
Solid food and a near-private dining experience.

This place always seems pretty empty when I walk by, but I came here for dinner with two friends and we had a good meal. Sashimi is fresh and there are some good roll options. My one complaint was that there were several flies circling our table for the latter part of the meal - wondering if someone had a door open in the back. Would come back again.
author: Emily F.

description:
Food is good for the most part, but service is S L O W. It also doesn't help that I'm brown. 
Also, prices listed on their menu online are different than the menus they have at the restaurant. It's misleading, please update.
author: Diana C.

description:
I'm writing the review as we are sitting at the table waiting for our order. It's been 50 min after our order was in and nothing came, not even water. We ordered a chicken salad, sukiyaki, and some appetizer, don't know why it's taking them so long. 

Then the worst thing was that they got our orders wrong and tried to lie to us that it was the correct order. We found it out and argued with them but  they said you can just choose not to pay us tip...Horrible experience and would avoid at no cost.
author: Shengkun Y.

description:
If you're ordering takeout, don't be fooled by the pricing on their website or Eat24. Actual menu pricing is several dollars more than what is listed online for most items. I made them aware of this issue months ago, and they still have the same incorrect pricing online. I spoke with the manager, and all he had to say was "we've been doing this for 35 years" as if that makes it OK for them to have published false pricing. He blamed Eat24 for being all messed up but when I asked him about the pricing on his website, he says, "I don't know what to tell you, our prices are our prices." 

As mentioned in some other reviews, the food here is OK. This isn't the first service issue that I've had here, but I try again every couple of months because they are in the neighborhood. No more after today.
author: Dennis H.

description: I know this is the City and all but dang, $20 for sushi (similar to "Lion King")?! The rolls were so tiny and he barely put any of the California roll filling in the middle. I was extremely disappointed! You would think you would get more food for paying that much but no they totally rip you off! Each roll would fall apart when I picked it up, it was a mess. It didn't even taste that great either. I could get a better roll for twice the size less rice & half the prize elsewhere! I don't know how that place makes business. I would never recommend this to place to anyone! Never again!
author: Elle M.

description:
Ten-Ichi is my new favorite PacHeights sushi spot... not too crowded, but fabulously clean restaurant. The sushi was creative and very fresh (having sat at the sushi bar watching, I can vouch). Prices are not cheap, but worth it for the quality of the fish.

Don't miss out on the house-smoked salmon, it's unbelievable!
author: Kerry G.

description: The first time I came here, I sat at a table and the service was pretty slow an unattentive. The performance at the bar is much, much better. The people here are nice, the food is good, but they play games with the bill. On my most recent visit, they charged my card 50% more than the price that they displayed on the original check brought to me. When I asked about this, the waitress responsible for the charge had to verify the constituent pieces of the check with the rest of the staff. Now, you could chalk this up to human error, but during the course of my visit, two other patrons from completely separate parties also exclaimed quite loudly that they were mischarged. One of these patrons was in a party that was of just two individuals, where they were attempting to split the bill. One was charged the correct amount, and one was charged something completely incorrect, like not even a divisible factor of the orignal bill. I don't understand how you screw up a split bill for a party of two. Anyway, in trying to reason about my own billing error, I did notice that my check was written out in a way that was completely confusing. But I knew what I ordered, and so did the staff. There's definitely a problem with this piece of the business. Or not. They've been around for 40+ years. Now, on to the food. The soba noodles were pretty good. So were my two orders of sashimi. The fish was fresh, but not acquired day of. Serving sizes for fish were not great at all---for $16 you get two slivery slices of bluefin tuna. Okay. It's an expensive fish. But really, guys, that just smells bad (figuratively. The restaurant itself smells fine. There are gnats that fly around your food, but there is no fishy smell.) On to the seating experience. I sat at the bar. Very friendly and helpful staff, and friendly clientele. I liked that they bring you a wrapped-in-plastic warmed washcloth. Bottom line: If you're on Fillmore and you have an itch for sushi, Ten-ichi won't completely disappoint, but it's SF and there are better options.
author: Ian M.

description: The best sushi  in SF as far as I am concerned sit at the bar and ask Ken what he suggests you can't go wrong he is a Samurai of a sushi chef and a all around great guy once you get to know him he will make every visit special!!!
author: Azikiwee A.

description: This has been my go-to sushi restaurant for 20 years. Excellent friendly service comes with the fresh sushi, great rolls and I love the green salad. On a chilly SF night the udon dinners are an excellent choice.
author: Shannon A.

description: The sushi chef who was wearing a 49ers baseball hat and presumably the owner is a pompous, mean and condescending man.  I have never written a post before but watching him interact with the staff was so horrible to witness.  He should not be in the business of serving people and nourishing them.  We don't need people like this in SF.
author: Kristin C.

description: Loved every single thing I ate here. Everyone needs to eat here!! The food is outstanding.  The service is prompt and super friendly. Love coming here whenever I'm in the city. Yummy!!!!
author: Alison S.

description: Absolute the worst dining experience ever!! My husband and I stopped by the restaurant on a busy Saturday night. When we stepped in, we waited for 10 min before somebody guided us to seats. The restaurant was very empty compare to other restaurants on the same st. We should take that as a red flag and left. We sat for about 25 min nobody came over to greet us nor serve drinks. We had to came over to find the waitress cuz we were so hungry. After making the order, we waited for another 40 min or so, my husband came over to the waitress and asked for our food. The waitress served us a bowl of rice with beef, I asked her "what is that? Was it the sukiyaki bowl (hot pot soup with vegetable, beef and noodles)?" Because it looked nothing like that, when I ordered I even showed her the picture. She said without a blink of an eye" it is! It's actually a different type of Sukiyaki" As Sukiyaki is one of my favorite Japanese dishes that I order all the time, there's no way it is Sukiyaki. After eating half of it, I feel very frustrated I called the manager over and asked him what it is, the manager told me it's not Sukiyaki, I got super upset not because we are waiting for one hr for this meal, but it's that the waitress lied in front of us that she could just said that I'm sorry I made a mistake. Without doing that she tried to tell us that it's a "different type" of Sukiyaki!!!! Everyone will make mistake and it's not a big deal, but lying to clients it's not ok!! The most frustrating part was that on the bill, they still charged us the full price for Sukiyaki!!!! Which we didn't have! I asked the waitress why, she said " look! If I made a mistake, you could have return it when I serve it to you, but now you are half of it so you need to pay" I said " first of all, this is not the dish we ordered and you lied right in front of us and let us try your "different type" of Sukiyaki , now we have to pay more for the dish that we never had?!" What the waitress replied really astonished me, she said " you don't need to pay me any tips, just pay the dish and leave" That moment I did what she told me, I don't want to waste my time arguing with such type of waitress. She made all the guests feel so worthless, she ordered the wrong dish and lied to us and we all have to pay for it. On our way out, we met another couple outside who was seating right next to us, and told us " we didn't pay any tips because my wife and I had this dish for 2 hrs, they missed one of our order when we asked her, she said " do you need this now? " my wife and I don't want to waste another hr, so we left" worst restaurant experience ever!!!!
author: Keting S.

description:
This place is technically 4 stars, but because it's excellent value for the price, I'm giving it an extra star (so 5 stars for this price range).

- The sushi chef at the bar is really nice and is an excellent sushi chef. Nigiri is always excellent here - well made, great sushi rice, good quality fish.
- Garlic spicy edmame is delicious.
- Mushroom miso soup is awesome.
- Gyoza is homemade and REALLY good
- It's never too busy and there is no wait
- TV at the bar with sports playing if you're looking to catch a game while you eat

I've tried sushi far and wide thru SF and beyond (including Japan) and I'd highly recommend this place if you're looking to go somewhere casual that doesn't have a wait or requires reservation, & serves excellent quality sushi at a can't be beaten price (by SF standards).

Two thumbs up! I will be regularly going here.
author: Pratul L.

description:
Been here numerous times and it's consistently "meh, I've experienced better." Not the worst sushi I've ever had, in fact it's more like a 3/5 for quality of fish (ie, "acceptable").

The biggest ding here is for the "service," which is at a 1/5. In no particular order:

- Last 3-4 times I've been in and sat at the bar I've been hassled by the "younger" of two sushi chefs who tries to upsell expensive items like a used car salesman (best part is the dismissive attitude if you go "nah, I'll actually have X instead" / "fine, whatever, suit yourself" *spits on ground and mutters*)
- Same "younger" sushi chef will start shutting down the bar at like, ~8:30p (they close at 10, but that's like, lights out at 10 apparently). I asked for a roll at 8:31p and got told the bar was closed. Seriously?
- Absent minded waitress/waiter if you get the tables. I'm patient AF and really don't mind having to go "uh, yeah, still waiting on that X item" but it's a regular occurrence here.

TL:DR -- If you're stuck on Fillmore and starving for sushi, you won't die going here. However, better bet is to give yourself an extra 10 minutes to walk down Fillmore to Japantown and take your pick of ANY sushi spot there, guaranteed you'll do better than this last-resort.
author: Teo D.

description:
Hamachi Specialty Roll - best burst of flavor in sushi I've. Ever. Had
Salmon sashimi - way to expensive
author: Lina H.

description: Slow service.  We kept looking around. The server was nice but geez.  We waited and everyone in the party kept commenting that we hadn't ordered yet.  I got the omakase nigiri.  Nothing great. Not expensive but still not worth it.  Then while she was running our cards, they had closed and they opened the door to let the cold air in.  Obviously asking us to leave yet we hadn't paid yet.
author: Shannon S.

description: Love this great friendly family owned restaurant! Try the curry, sashimi and tempura !!! Yum ! In today's world of big corporate restaurant chains, this place is so refreshing!  The fish is always super fresh and tasty!
author: Chris C.

description:
Color me green! I hate to be the Grinch but meeeeh, I've experienced better. 

Pro's:

- super friendly and attentive service
- clean bathrooms
- on Filmore (Lower Pacific Heights)

Con's:

- overpriced bento boxes ($25 - really?)
- quality: sushi fell apart
- presentation was a bit awkward (see picture)

An okay place to satisfy your sushi craving when you're in the area because of the lack of competition. Give it a try and judge for yourself but I wasn't impressed.
author: Sebastian F.

description: I went to this place on a Friday night when my mother was out of town. I enjoyed the beef teriyaki, rice, mezo soup, and tofu! If you haven't been here or are visiting the city from somewhere else, you should definitely try this out!
author: Asher D.

description: We had a bad experience many years ago at this locale and stayed away until trying a dinner a few nights ago. What a disappointment! The only worthwhile items were the green tea to start and the complementary chocolate dessert to finish. The stuffed mushrooms were absolutely tasteless. The chicken Kara-age was so-so as far as the chicken goes but placed with tasteless lettuce. The same disappointing lettuce was used with the "ordinary" salmon teriyaki. No more returns to this restaurant!
author: Michael B.

description: the service was terrible. One person's meal was served more than 10 minutes after the first person's meal was served. We canceled an appetizer order when it was not delivered before the meals were provided. The food is below average and the price is above average. another sushi restaurant at 706 Sutter where the sushi is much better.
author: Walker S.

description:
Popped by during Jazz fest. LOVE IT!!!!
They during something special for the event and I got to eat their furikake fries and poke! Baaahhhhhh! Happpyyyyyyy.

You should come here. Or come here again! ;)
author: Ghia E.

description: Ten-Ichi is a great neighborhood spot. Their sushi is okay, but their udon is really great. I'm a huge sushi snob and I refuse to settle for mediocre sushi, so I rarely eat sushi outside of fancy restaurants. But I love all kinds of Japanese food, and they really make some good udon. My favorite is the tempura udon. They're a regular take-out choice for me, but I rarely eat there. It's a cozy spot though-- I think they recently renovated it too.
author: Lee A.

description: I wanted to love this place coming here the second time , but I can't! The service has gotten so worst here , the flies have camped on tables, sticky dirty tables, and the food is subpar from what you're paying for. They really ONLY care about making money from their take-out or to go calls. Every chance I had to get someone's attention they are either on the phone taking orders, relay racing towards the kitchen, or taking orders at a table. I get it, you're under staffed but wouldn't you think being in a busy street you're in-making the money you're making, you hired more servers? Also my boyfriend got food poisoning from the under cooked chicken teriyaki, and we mention this to our server. It's hard to see when the whole restaurant is so damn dark and the taste of the chicken gave us the hint to stop eating! Sushi is expensive for the quality and quantity you are receiving. Come here if you want non existent service, oblivious to "authentic Japanese food", and enjoy being in cave. I'll skip and journey to Japan town.
author: Annie L.

description:
Sorry to share this bad experience...we are from the neighborhood..eating out approx 14-21 times a week in and around the neighborhood

This was my second time at Tenichi...the first time was great....we posted to share our awsom first time experience here + recommended to many friends.

Last night, Tuesday of Christmas week we chose to stop in for some sushi on our way  for some holiday cheer + movie. 

We experienced such a rude waiter. We had to request napkins + water at least 3-4 times..the soup was extremely over heated in plastic bowls with plastic spoons - the city of SF has even banned hot food packaged in plastic or styrofoam for being unhealthy. The better healthy concious spots serve hot food in glass or porcelain not cheapo plastic ware.Seriously, who really wants unhealthy pb's leeched from cheap plastic in their soup or food?!

The waiter smiled and was nice to the tables around us however every time he approached our table we got the mean, rude, dirty looks  from him. When we requested water, a soup spoon or anything he was so rude and gave us such ugly looks. it was obvious he did not appreciate us at his table! On the way to the washroom, I had to pass the same waiter..he gave me the rudest  looks again..my friend noticed at the table too! He mentioned to me, maybe it was a language barrier??

honestly we have never experienced rude service before at any restaurant or bar or venue in the city...this is such a great neighborhood and community, everyone is so nice - this was so surprising and atypical of the neighborhood community we know and love. Our groups of friends work, live and play all around the neighborhood, everyone agrees it is very awsom here.

Since we receive rockstar and friendly service all over the neighborhood and are friends with the staffs at pretty much all the other top spots in the neighborhood, we were quite surprised.

We will never eat here again. There are so many awsom sushi spots around the city, we did not appreciate our rude service and bad vibes with our mediocre sushi. The food was not awful, it was average....there are many fantastic options around pac heights..Out the Door down the street is mindblowing every time and they are nice!.

In a nutshell - Very Unpleasant experience while out to enjoy some holiday cheer! Really bad vibe from the waiter. It soured the taste of the mediocre sushi. You can do So Much Better in the city, the standards are so high here there are so many awsom sushi spots. We love a nearby sushi spot on 6th and California..also Blowfish is fantastic.  Live Sushi SOMA is another good one!
author: T Maria L.

description:
Food was pretty good, but it didn't outweigh the "decor." The table next to us was covered in flies, cushions on the bench against the wall had holes covered with duct tape, and the place looks like it hasn't been cleaned in months.

I was swatting at the flies while the waitress came up, mentioned the flies, and she just smiled and walked away. 

Doubt I'll ever go back.
author: I AM SOFA KING WE TODD DI D.

description: Sushi and service was OK. It was nothing special, not all that much flavor.
author: Jen G.

description: What happened to this place? Did the original owner so? The food is so slow, the prices are high, and the portions are so small. It has a nice remodel but I think it attracts patrons who don't know any better about what could Japanese food is.
author: Jacob J.

description: Only gave it 3 stars because I really liked the chicken + veggies curry dish. It could've used a lot more veggies instead of those that came with a separate salad. It took some time after we seated for our order to be taken. Everything else felt a bit rushed.
author: Linda S.

description:
Endulged twice now. Went in for lunch a second time. Never again. The lunch special was a bento box and I chose teriaki chicken which didn't have enough sauce and worse yet the chicken was tough to chew signaling it had been frozen, and appeared premade.
 Way too much salad dressing. 
Ordered two pieces of Unagi and it came cold which should have been hot!  Also, they were $4 each.  Took way too long for lunch to be delivered in a restaurant that have maybe 8 people
Many other choice on Filmore street.
author: P G.

description: I've eaten here at the sushi bar and had a fantastic meal... came last Saturday for some nigiri omakase and it tasted just okay. Will give it another try at the sushi bar as I think you get the chefs attention much more.
author: Sarah A.

description: I've been here a number of times, and it has never been great.  Doesn't seem run well.  The fish is mediocre.  Not much going for them outside of being local.
author: T B.

description: Service is horrible and food is just okay. If you have all day to wait for a roll of sushi then you should try this. Waitress was also very rude.
author: Sona M.

description: The sushi menu is separate from the regular menu. Tried the hamachi firecracker special roll along with Malbec from Argentina. Had the wine to finish. Tasty and good service.
author: Linda H.

description:
Ten-Ichi covers the ground that makes me a semi-regular here. The wait service is excellent. My last experience at Ten-Ichi reinforced my overall high impression of their good service. They were checking in on my table with some regularity and always with a kind smile. Not to mention, your water glass will never be empty. 

The overall ambiance of Ten-Ichi reveals a relaxing tone accompanied by a tropical fish tank and taste full artwork on the walls. It's very easy to have a conversation in Ten-Ichi without ambient noise as a distraction. I'd suggest coming to Ten-Ichi when you are in very good company that you are interested in talking with, or if you're looking to relax after a stressful work day. 

Quality of food is standard, it's what you would expect from a Japanese restaurant. Good selection of house rolls and shashimi. Lunch specials are always my go to. Especially the sauteed green beans with chicken. 

Bottom line: Excellent service, calm ambiance.
author: Jaime W.

description: Restaurant is NOT open Monday when it says it is on yelp. Sushi is mediocre- nothing that I would seek out and would not recommend with the many better options in Japan town. This place is merely convenient due to the location.
author: JP S.

description: Well..........what a bummer. The fish was o.k. I was so confused about the chaos of the Resturant.......here's my take its a mom and pop place. It's over priced but decent enough to run by for something quick with limited expectations.......horrible wine. Decent sake......
author: Amavi D.

description:
& the search for a go-to sushi spot continues..

Sushi is fresh but overpriced-they don't let you know that some rolls are just 4 pieces. Too much rice on some "filler rolls"

Some of the rolls simply try too hard-weird vinaigrette sauce

TV at the bar is a plus..

Won't be back unfortunately.
author: Sarah G.

description: If you are into sushi - but really into sushi then this is it.  Sit at the counter and order directly from the sushi chefs - they know their fish and know what they are doing..
author: John T.

description: Been going here since I was a kid. Best fish in town, service is excellent and Steve is the Man.  Creative rolls and classic rolls are all good. Sashimi is amazing and trust me its worth it. Home made soy sauce on your roll if you are lucky. Order the cold noodle salad!
author: Griffin C.

description: So what can I say.. We have been to this restaurant twice. The first time I would give the sushi 3 stars and last night 2. They were really backed up so service was slow. The sushi didn't taste fresh or chilled. Will we be back? not sure. I think we need to start exploring Japantown.
author: Susan S.

description:
While this place is a little overpriced, I SPLURGE for it. You can taste the quality in the fish and the service is outstanding. The head chef, Steve, is always coming up with new hand rolls and is more than willing to create new things for you - if you are sitting at the counter. We go to watch Warriors games, as they are local sports fans. They make soy sauce and ginger in house, and have a pretty nice happy hour.

If you want some quality sushi, come here! If you're looking for 100 different types of rolls at a cheap price, head down to Godzilla.
author: Wendy K.

description:
$2 sapporo with a side of edamame?! Sweet! 

We stopped here while shopping on Fillmore St, and looking for a possible happy hour anywhere. 

Stepping in, it was a cute small place, and we were seated right away. For 5pm, it was actually busier than I expected it to be. We ordered our beer, which was a Sapporo on tap. Not bad for $2. 

Also decided to order one of their dinner boxes-it compromised of green salad, tempura, yakisoba and chicken karrage. The food was pretty good, karrage made with white meat. 

The service was a bit lacking as we could never find our server.  Even paying for our bill took a while.

Would recommend coming for the $2 beer.
author: Vincci L.

description: I have many problems with this place. I passed by Ten-Ichi and decided to eat here just for the heck of it. I have been here a few times, and of all the times I've been here, I've had a horrible experience. The tables are never clean, and the food is never as fresh as I expect it to be. I have had many rolls of sushi from this place, and they all had very little fish, and was not fresh. Basically in terms of sushi, anywhere in the city would be better than getting it from here. The donburi that I also had once was extremely salty and the meat was not generous. Also the nabemono had little udon and the soup was very bland. I was hoping after trying a few dishes here I might find something I like, but I didn't. The service was exceptional, however. I usually come during the lunch hours, and the waitress Vivian is there. She really checks up on you and makes you feel comfortable as possible. I am only giving a one-star for the service, not the food. In general, this is one of the bad restaurants in the city. Overlall, I will never be coming back.
author: Charlotte G.

description:
Pros: it's a quick fix. 
- Happy hour is fair. Large bento boxes, decent food.
- Chicken karaage is delicious. I'd recommend getting it.

Cons:
- Sushi is the size of a quarter: http://imgur.com/nf0rOvB
I needed a quick sushi fix so I ordered 8 pieces of the crazy roll. Yeah, that's not 4 pieces-- THATS 8! That was $10.
author: Ashlee B.

description: Amazing! The service was great, the food was amazing, and the atmosphere was awesome! This was probably some of the freshest sushi I've had other than nobu! Absolutely amazing!
author: Alexiz G.

description:
I ate here this week with a group during lunch. My main criticism is that it was packed during lunch, and there was only one main waitress trying to manage a full house including about 3 large groups. She was trying her best, but also wasn't the most assertive chick. 
We ordered sashimi, and pork and halibut gyoza for the table. I ordered a bento box special - great deal - for $8.50 (maybe a little more) I got chicken teriyaki and rice, miso soup, California roll, and tempura vegetables. It was pretty good. Not incredible, but good. I would eat here again.
author: Melissa B.

description: family friendly, family run.  gyoza, seaweed salad delicious.  sashimi fresh and tasty.  specialty rolls good. broths/udon delicious.  a quiet restaurant, mildly understaffed, but responsive friendly cooperative servers.  maybe not a date night scene or trendy, but calm and delicious.  we've been back many times and would return again.
author: Molly M.

description:
This is my homey go to Japanese restaurant when I don't feel well or need to have home-made food. And it's an all encompassing restaurant with decent quality in everything: udon, don (over rice dishes), salad, sushi, and sashimi. Though it is my go-to place for kanpachi whenever I have a craving (there are better places, but if i need to need kanpachi sashimi for a week, everyday, I go here to be safe). So it's not just a sushi place but more like a every day Japanese place, and its a very fair one. May not be the most amazing, but always consistent. Hence it's my go-to place when in need.

The staff is on the serious side, but in fact they are very Japanese and very polite, so they tend to look and appear intense/ formal. Don't let it get to you. In fact they are very nice. 

Worth noting is that there is a sushi counter, so if that's what you like. Also it is good fo solo dining. If you need a get-away, this is an awesome Japanese restaurant in the sense that you won't be optimized out of the way: if it's your turn you get a table, and get to enjoy your personal bubble. If you are really hungry, close your menu quickly so you can order right away, other it may be slightly slow.
author: Dilys S.

description:
Sushi is not very good off the menu and it's way over priced. 

If you sit at the sushi bar the younger looking sushi chef is great and will make you a bunch of rolls that aren't on the menu. Those are all really good but anything off the menu is just meh. Unless you sit at the bar and order from the younger sushi chef it's not worth eating here.
author: Lizzy U.

description: It was a quiet night but my friend recommended it so we took our chances. Thank goodness we did. Delicious tuna and yellow sushi! I had the udon beef soup. All fantastic!
author: Myrna N.

description:
This place has stepped it up. I ate here a few years ago when I first moved to the area and didn't really think much of it. It wasn't the best, but it wasn't bad either.

A friend invited me back a few weeks ago and I've returned a few times since. Whether you're looking for complex/sauce-covered rolls or more traditional style nigiri/sashimi, the sushi here is awesome. I highly suggest sitting at the bar. Steve knows his stuff when it comes to sushi and definitely won't do you wrong. Everyone has a different definition of what "sushi" is what type of "sushi" they enjoy eating, so just let him know what you like and he'll point you in the right direction.
author: Brian B.

description:
This place is quite the hidden gem. I was always suspect on it walking by as a local as it was never busy with diners. One night I decided to try it for take-out and was pleasantly surprised. The food is good .... really good! Their sushi and rolls are a highlight and they have great variety on their menu. They execute all the japanese traditional dishes really well. Udon, tick, yakitori (any thing grilled) tick, Karage tick, bento box tick and so on! Plus the staff are really lovely, you really get the family owned and operated vibe when you visit.
P.S. Sushi as a cuisine is a delicacy and is not supposed to be cheap. So if you're not in to paying for quality food don't bother coming here. I'm really saddened by people giving this place bad reviews because of price!
author: Julia B.

description: Hands down the freshest and most amazing sushi I have ever had in my life. I'm from San Diego and came up here to visit a friend. We ended up here and I am blessed! Steve is amazing, words can't describe how much this man made me eat and I am so grateful. If you don't come here you're dumb. Best sushi in the world !
author: Rissa C.

description: Me and my coworkers ordered Lunch Bento boxes and their about $10 each and I got the Chicken Teriyaki and the chicken is very little its like 1/3 of a chicken breast. The Tempura is good but my coworker had a bug in her salad which made us all not want to eat the salad. The only reason why we order from here is becasue we work at the hospital and this is the only Japanese restaurant close to us but we will never eat here again.
author: Lennie G.

description: Decent sushi, but nothing that I haven't seen before. I don't think I still have found that one Sushi place in SF quite yet. Overall, fast and friendly service though.
author: Dominique F.

description: Have had happy hour and sushi here for the past three nights pretty sure I am hooks the owners are great people and very friendly. If your in the area would stop and and have some dinner and sushi. Worth the money
author: Robert A.

description: QUALITY, QUALITY, QUALITY. Sushi and sashimi are super fresh and delicious. Slightly upscale price but worthwhile. Brand new, renovated interior completed in 2016. Have been enjoying this Fillmore & Clay essential since 2000.
author: Stella Y.

description: Ten-ich I is seriously some of the tastiest most fresh sushi I've ever had. I hate writing long reviews so the only other thing I'll say is sit at the bar and order the fresh sashimi!
author: Sam N.

description: Best meal I've ever eaten!!! MUST have the carpaccio! This place is the real deal! Family owned & operated! Can't go wrong here! I dream of their food frequently! Yum yum!!!
author: Jenn E.

description:
This place rocks - not sure why they don't have 5 stars.  Ten-Ichi rivals sushi in Japantown and certainly blows any other Fillmore restaurant out of the park.

Sit at the sushi bar if you can - the chefs are funny and entertaining and the service is great.
author: Jordan P.

description:
Dear Ten-Ichi, 
I had my first negative experience with your restaurant last night.  I'll call it an off night, and it won't stop me from ordering again from you- but it will put you on probation for sure.  My take out order, while accurate, was assembled in a bit of a lack-luster manner.  The one roll I ordered- an 'All American' roll, was quite nice, but the cuts of nigiri didn't look 'as expected', and were sloppily assembled.  Worst off- my toro was unacceptable- skunky in taste and smell, cut poorly, and with an inedible/ unchewable vein-like tendon comprising the length of the cut and 1/4 of the mass.  For what you charge, the toro should be the 'most perfect' piece in the order, and not a cast-off like this.  I had to do a double-take because it didn't look like anything I had ever received from you previously- I thought it looked like a clam or something but it definitely wasn't.

I've been a fan of your restaurant for a long time, ordering 8-12 times a year- almost all take-out with an occasional stop at the sushi bar. This was the weakest execution yet.  I'll call it an off-night, and hope that things go back to my expectations next time. I don't want to punish you prematurely for a bad experience after so many good ones...
author: Andy S.

description:
Ten-ichi has been around for a long time because the food is good and the service is great. It is a cozy place to enjoy a decent meal.   My Japanese boyfriend enjoys dining here although he says it isn't very authentic.  He mostly likes the low key atmosphere, serene service and that it is owned and operated by a Japanese family.  Many Japanese restaurants in San Francisco are not. 

I enjoy their Tempura, Salmon Teriyaki and Seafood Yosenabe. The Sushi is OK, not great but certainly better than most of the Japanese restaurants in nearby Japantown.  But, what do I know.  I'm not an expert on Japanese cuisine.

The restaurant isn't loud and the service is attentive without being annoying.  This is a calm place to dine and enjoy conversation with your family and friends without having to shout across the table to be heard.
author: Donna P.

description: The Shrimps and Vegetables Tempura (14.50) was good, but the sushi quality here is really disappointing. I got the Chirashi (22) and not only was it a small dish overall, but each piece of fish was limp, thin, lackluster, and bland.
author: Cynthia W.

description:
Stopped in for dinner. I enjoyed my food, but I was very displeased with the service. 

We were seated pretty quickly during prime time on a Friday (wait was only 10min, which is great for our neighborhood). But alas, although the crowd in the restaurant was beginning to wane, we still had to wait 15 minutes or maybe more for the waitress to take our order. That was probably the only true lapse in service, but be aware that if you're coming here, you're in for a "relaxed" dining experience. It only they would immediately take a drink order and follow up a few minutes later with the food order, the relaxed pace might actually be welcomed. 

My wife and I shared the Veggie Bento and the Veggie Sukiyaki. I also had the Spicy Scallop roll. We both had Sapporo on tap. 

The Veggie Bento is huge. You get a cold noodle salad and miso soup to start, and the bento itself has tempura veggies, agedashi fried tofu, eggplant and tofu in sauce, and 4 pieces of a mixed vegetable roll. Rice was included. I enjoyed all the elements of this entree, although nothing stood out as particulary "awesome." 

The veggie sukiyaki was tasty. I'm not sure if it was "good" compared to other sukiyakis, because this is the first time I've ever had this kind of dish. That said, again, I enjoyed it. It came with a miso soup for starters, and was also accompanied by rice. The broth was sweet but not overbearing, and it was chock full of vegetables (though mostly cabbage). I thought there would be more noodles in the dish, but I'm not sure what is normal, so I don't want to complain. 

However, I was disappointed by the Spicy Scallop roll. This is the 'testpiece' I order at all sushi restaurants, so I know how to compare it. It wasn't spicy and the scallop wasn't particularly flavorful. Also, it was $8, but you only got 4 pieces. I'm used to a roll being at least 6 pieces, so that was disappointing. 

I will likely be back, but probably only for the cooked dishes, not the sushi.
author: Allison S.

description:
Pro: good happy hour and lunch deals

Cons: WORST sushi place ever because... 
1. Takes FOREVER for sushi rolls. 
2. servers are rude and dont care about you. interesting only delivering food and taking order. 
3. Servers does not speak english, or well enough to answer questions you might have. 
4. disorganized menu - roll menus are everywhere, on table, piece of paper, on laminated menu... would be nice to have ONE LIST. 
5. I sat down on 6: 20 pm and server did not come by till 6:35 to take my order. When I ordered happy hour menu, she refused as 'its past 6:30pm'. I replied 'I was here and you did not come by'. She acted as if she did not understand. I am very sure she did.
6. Taste- for 15 dollar roll, its waste of money. You are paying for location. 
7. Table- was poooorly cleaned. 

never again.
author: Jinn C.

description: I don't even have words for how plain there Special Bento box lunch special is.. My co-workers told me about it, I didn't listen and decided to try it.. never again. Nothing had flavor and the wasabi got on my sushi rolls YUCK.
author: D M.

description: Pretty sure my sake nigiri was frozen/thawed and the stuffed mushrooms were literally mushroom donuts. All the other nigiri I had were also very underwhelming. Would rather get sushi from whole foods. Sad bc I live so close and would love to frequent, but... I just can't.
author: Lillian S.

description: Used to be great and very kid friendly when the place was run by the parents and it was a lovey neighborhood place. The son has now taken over and it's definitely not kid friendly any more and the son has zero charm and is letting the standard of the food slip.
author: Ian V.

description:
Totally out of my comfort zone. I tried going safe with some teriyaki chicken but was slightly disappointed. Food tasted fairly blend. 

The location is pretty good in SF in a trendier zone.  Good experience but I probably wouldn't come back.
author: Nim N.

description:
When I lived in Japan, all I ate was udon. Big fat fluffy udon. 

This place has that. It was fantastic- just like being back in Nishi Kasi- except it was 4x the price. Still delicious on a freezing cold night.
author: Emily D.

description: My favorite neighborhood joint! I love the atmosphere (been in pacific HTS for 30+ years). The whole family is involved and the sushi is always fresh and delicious! Albacore sashimi is my favorite! Love Ken the sushi chef!
author: Whitney H.

description:
Tenichi is a cool little sushi joint in the Pacific Heights area of SF. Granted, I've never been to Pacific Heights previously but when visiting SF last month....its my kind of vibe...nice chill upscale neighborhoods with some nice chill upscale shops...no dirty hippies up in this hood. 

Anyways, went to the sushi bar and ordered a bunch of different rolls and whatevz..kind of lost track of what they were, but the rolls were quite bomb..lots of different fusion type of items as well as some traditional sushi which was really good. the sushi chef was real casual but had some good honest recommendations. It was like one of my bros was the sushi chef and wanted to hook you up with the "good isht". 

Some people may not like the casual environment, but I thought it was a welcome change since it was so interactive and he'd give recos based on the fish he had in stock and your personal preferences. Basically it was like if "Cheers" was a sushi bar..lots of neighborhood regulars and a good repoire with the sushi bar.
author: Eric t.

description: I'm obviously a fan because I come here regularly for lunch. I like it very much because it's quick and easy.  I've ordered the sushi rolls at least once before but I don't even remember the taste of it because the price sticks out in my mind. They are a pricey sushi restaurant, but their lunch specials are fairly reasonable.  I usually order the same thing which is always the salmon teriyaki and the chicken karage or the shrimp tempura. You can't go wrong with those. The service is quick and friendly and you never wait long for a table.
author: Sharon B.

description: Cozy spot for sushi and Japanese. Easy to linger and they have a happy hour menu, which is nice. The sushi was solid and fresh, but the roll choices were nothing to write home about. One note is I thought it was funny that they have a post about parking options for the restaurant in the men's bathroom.
author: Andrew K.

description:
After one of my dr.'s appts. I was starving and was craving for Japanese food so my husband and I stopped by Ten-Ichi since it was the closest Japanese restaurant to my dr.'s office.  

We were greeted immediately after entering the restaurant and the host mentioned we can sit anywhere we would like since there were only 2 other patrons there.  We decided to sit right next to their aquarium since it was freezing outside and we didn't want to be too close to the window/doors. 

Since I can't order sushi with my preggers self, I opted for one of their bento boxes which was a bit on the pricier side for lunch.   But it was fresh and still very delicious!  My husband ordered a healthy chicken dish for lunch and enjoyed it as well.  Our total came out to $26 without tip so it wasn't too bad.  I can't wait to return to try their sushi. 

They provided excellent service so I will definitely return.
author: Christine P.

description:
Ten-Ichi ROCKS. Period. :) haha no that would be a lame review. 

Truth is...you can't find a better place for a feel good, happy home, delicious sushi spot in the Bay. You walk in and feel cozy, but also know there's some good food to be had. I hear they're revamping their restaurant to make it even more awesome. Sounds good to me!
I love the family who own Ten-Ichi..they make you feel welcome and want you to just be happy. Thanks Ten-Ichi because as easy as it sounds, so many people do it wrong. You all deserve a wink and a smile.

We've all had sushi rolls and yes they can all be good, but Ten-Ichi managed to not only make sushi rolls that taste AMAZING, but fresh, clean, and something new! The American Dream Roll..yeah..you have to go there.  Really all of their 5-10 rolls I tried there ROCK!! :) Sashimi..a true test of freshness..and yes..they can do it. 

In addition, they just do traditional Japanese well with some small plates to feed your taste for a variety of food and possibly save you some money to keep in your pocket. But let's face it, you don't want to keep your money in your wallet when there's so much good stuff to be eaten. But you'll also be happily surprised with the decent costs of everything here. I know this sounds silly, but don't leave without some dessert. Pear, Mango, or Green Tea Ice cream topped with some fresh strawberries is such a sweet touch. And just perfect after a belly of yummy sushi. 

Overall..I can see Ten-Ichi being a place i visit over and over again for years to come. Because I know I could have my favs, but always trust to try something new and fabulous. :) They've been around for 30+ years..it definitely shows in their fOod, ambience, and welcoming good vibes. :) Love it.
author: Bernice L.

description:
Five stars for sushi bar! Fresh sushi!  One of my friends took me here because I was complaining that SF didnt have a good solid sushi places - and I really don't want to be driving out to Kirala all the time...  
So the adventure to find best sushi began.  They have FRESH and yummy sushi.  they dont need to fluff up their sushi with lots of sauces...  go to the sushi bar and try out different sushi there.  you wont regret it!
author: Katelyn M.

description:
Sushi is always fresh..Ken and Steve are the best! Ask and they shall make! This place has been my go-to for several years. Laid back, friendly service, excellent sushi and Japanese dishes. The beef udon is great! Udon noodles just right, hearty and good cuts of beef. 

Service is usually great, if it's lunch and crowded, expect a little lag. I like the addition of the TV a couple years ago, makes for sitting at the bar even more enjoyable. The owners are there most nights and are kind, generous people. Always making sure things are running smoothly.

A great place for a casual meal with friends and family or first date...or yummy solo sushi at the bar watching hoops and chatting with Ken and Steve. Thanks for feeding me !
author: Liz C.

description:
Happy Hour (daily from 5pm to I think 6:30pm):
-- $2 Sapporo beers
-- $~10 for a variety of meals: bento boxes (w/ chicken katsu, tonkatsu, etc), donburi + noodles (udon or soba)

The food is simple, and it's good in its simpleness.  The meat is tenderly cooked, but probably could be a wee bit more flavorful.

I also tried the Tuna Poke (not on the Happy Hour Menu), which was good, but also not as flavorful as I expected.  However, because of the milder sauce, I definitely could tell that the cuts of tuna were fresh.  The price was a bit much though, and I could get more for cheaper elsewhere.  (Photo: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/T1DIDe7MdSdPOpPT_VJzpw?select=x1ftq7OCHcV0xhED-peNqg )

This place is only worth coming to for happy hour, or maybe for a geriatrically-early dinner, which I have been tending to do.
author: Jeanne L.

description:
I ordered takeout for lunch - the sushi tastes alright, but it is TINY and expensive, even by Pac Heights standards. I've uploaded a photo of my hand holding the box - for two people which they packed together for some reason - to show how small it is. 
$25 for this. 

Apparently the seaweed/nori only comes in one size, so that's as big as the rolls can be. I don't think so.
author: Steve W.

description:
I wanted to like this place, especially as their lunch special is so reasonably priced, but the food is pretty terrible.

The tempura is greasy and soggy, and the salad was doused in this terrible dressing that was also greasy and soggy. 

The fish I had was decidedly mediocre.

The help is friendly and fast, but there a million Chinese-owned Japanese place that are far superior to this place.
author: Jacqueline A.

description: Best sushi I've had in years. Ordered the Craig roll which isn't on the menu. So fresh. So perfect. Also ordered the temptation roll. Un. Real. Not over done and the perfect kick of jalapeño. I recommend sitting at the sushi bar for additional fresh fish and sauces. Can't wait to go back.
author: Jessica K.

description:
Usually a good place for lunch while waiting for doctor appointments at Webster.

Great menu with plenty of options, excellent service and very consistent meals.

I've never sat back towards the sushi counter and don't recall if they have one since I've always been seated near the front.

Seems to be a very dependable and clean place.
author: Randall F.

description: Ten-Ichi has great sushi, but it's Steve that really makes this place a favorite neighborhood spot of mine. He's always improvising rolls, making great recommendations, or creating a completely new role based on your tastes/preferences. They have a decent Happy Hour - a draft Sapporo and edamame for about $3. There's also a tv in the corner of the bar, so you can count on Steve to always have the Giants or Warriors game on. Docked one star because it tends to be pretty pricey, but I will continue to be a regular.
author: Lauren C.

description:
My friend swears by this place so met up at the sushi bar, where Charming Steve entertained us while serving up some mean tuna carpaccio with roe and sesame seeds, and customized my salmon & veggie order with his sister. They grew up working for their parents, who have owned this place for 32 years. 

Steve pretended like he wasn't listening to our conversation but I know he heard everything while simultaneously cutting up some mean dishes and anticipating what we'd want next. Starting with the miso soup and the roasted rice green tea, all of the selections were fresh and did the trick. Could have been 3 stars but the family atmosphere, great location, excellent service and KILLER free mochi ice cream "palate clearers" at the end of the event (omg) - all likely contribute to the place being full of self-proclaimed regulars and push it to 4.
author: Diane B.

description:
This used to be my favorite sushi spot in the city.

Only amazing things to say about the chefs, very skilled and great personalities.  Also, they always have a tv with sports on.

However, the sushi just is not as quality as other places I have gone in the city.  A bummer, being that I live so close...
author: K G.

description: Amazing sushi and amazing service! This place is the BEST. I prefer more sushi and less rolls but even the rolls are amazing. Just ask the chef to make you whatever he wants. You can't go wrong.
author: Angeline T.

description:
We ordered from here a few times for lunch. It's close to where we work (2 blocks away) and so when we are craving Japanese, we order from here. Usually, someone else picks up for us so we don't know what the wait is like but the most recent time, we went to pick up by ourselves. We were not acknowledged for at least 5 minutes, maybe more. We were standing right by the register and the waiter and waitress walked by at least 10 times. For good service, I expect them to at least ask us what we want. They had no idea if we were there to pick up food, order, or anything! Finally, we got their attention to tell them that we are here to pick up take out. The man apologized and said they were busy (although the restaurant wasn't full), which is fine. I just want to know that you know I'm there and why I'm there. I also want to note that we were told to pick up in 25 minutes and it took about 35 minutes so be aware of that if you are ordering during your lunch hour. 

I got chicken katsu and gyoza for lunch. I would not suggest getting the bento box because I didn't like the tempura nor the California roll that they gave me last time. I don't like the veggies they include in the tempura and my coworkers usually just get shrimp tempura but not veggies too. The California roll last time was smooched and did not look good at all. I understand it was take out but it didn't taste good either. It didn't taste too fresh. As for the gyoza, it was a steamed kind. It was good enough but we didn't get a lot of gyoza sauce. I also didn't get enough chicken katsu sauce for my chicken katsu unfortunately :( The chicken katsu isn't bad though. They actually salt the chicken before frying so you can taste the saltiness. 

This place is also kind of expensive. For lunch for 4 people, we paid a little over $100. We only had the chicken katsu dinner, gyoza, tempura udon, and about 5 rolls.
author: Connie Y.

description:
An ok choice if you're in the area, but I think they can knock about $2-$3 off their overpriced bento boxes.  The base price is $12 for a choice of meat, salad or soup, and rice  (if you want California roll or salmon teriyaki with your combo, that's an extra $1 each! why???) 

I'm answering my own question: because you're in Pac Heights.

Service is attentive and the restroom is clean.  

I'll admit that I didn't even scan the menu for their sushi or sashimi, but judging from previous reviews, it may be worth another try again.
author: Janice C.

description: The taste was meh (I got the Caliente roll and the Clay roll) the portion size was very  small, and they got my one request (no cucumber) wrong. A roll should be six regular-size pieces, not four. Paid over 20 for the same amount/quality I would expect to get at a grocery store counter for $6.
author: K C.

description:
Call me sentimental, but I love that my parents used to come to this place before I was even born. Any establishment that stands the test of time deserves props in my book.

In terms of atmosphere, it has an upscale feel but isn't too stuffy. Both dishes that I've had (the udon soup and the sukiyaki) were absolutely delicious, and the servers were very knowledgeable about which options were truly vegetarian, down to the inclusion of fish broth. The food arrived quickly, and our Sapporo glasses were never dry.

It's a little pricey to be a go-to dinner spot, but whenever I have a craving for warm, comforting soup in my neighborhood, this is the place to go.
author: Sarah L.

description: When you are craving Japanese on Fillmore-this is the perfect authentic quick bite. No matter what you order. Lunch of course is such a deal but the best thing is they have such a varied menu for what ever you may be craving. Not top notch, but Good Enough. Chirashi was on the Small/edited side of most places, maybe order something else if you're hungry.
author: Lisa H.

description:
I live close by, so this is my go-to sushi place. It's super laid back, and honest to goodness, they absolutely spoil you with their sushi selection. It's all incredibly fresh, and their selection beats 99% of sushi restaurants in any city, anywhere. And I feel qualified to say that. 

Here's my tip: sit down at the sushi bar, ask them to set you up. They'll ask you some questions, customize the order for you, and you'll leave with your mind blown, particularly if you usually do rolls and/or you think sushi is all about tuna and salmon.

Great prices, awesome food, friendly and welcoming staff.
author: Russ W.

description:
Really good sushi.
Slighly overpriced but quality cuisine.
author: M E.

description:
Portion sizes at Ten Ichi have become unbelievably stingy. I weighed my salmon teriyaki (lunch portion) at home, and it was 2 ounces! No wonder I'm hungry after I eat there. 

I'm sorry, but you can't fill up a plate with fruit slices and salad and almost no salmon, and call it a salmon teriyaki lunch!
author: Debra R.

description:
This was possibly the worse service we received at an establishment, ever. 

We've been here before and never thought they would treat patrons like this. This was a sad day for ten-ichi. 

30 mins into our meal, half of our party of 4 got their meal and the other half continued to wait. We watched as people who arrived after us get their meal, pay and leave. We watched numerous to-go order leave the bar. We continued to wait. The waitress looked at us apologetically several times. We knew something about the service wasn't right and so did she.  Another 30 minutes and finally one of two rolls finally came out. Sad to say it didn't look appetizing. By then it was an 1 hour into our wait and we had prior engagements which couldn't be delayed by terrible service. Upon inquiring about our second dish we were rudely informed with, "Dude, you have to wait" by the man behind the counter.  Wow really?!? This is how you will address your customers? Terms such as "Dude?", not acceptable.  This unapologetic, superior tone from the man behind the counter was beyond disrespectful. Your staff treat the customers with respect and kindness only to be marred by the man behind the counters terrible attitude. Shouldn't call yourself a sushi chef.  

No one needs to be treated like that. We have respect for ourselves so we opted to get our check, forgo the last dish, choose not to eat dinner and leave. The man behind the counter loudly proclaimed, 'Ok. That's fine. They can go.' Wow, again. Wait, what did we do to get such disrespectful service? We loved this place in the past. Praised it. But for some reason he found some unforeseen fault in us. Directed some misplaced hatred on us. That's not ok. No one deserves to be treated like this. We brought out of the country guest here to enjoy what we had once considered great Japanese food. Boy were we both embarrassed and disappointed. We won't be making that mistake again. Good bye Ten-Ichi.
author: Tina Y.

description:
I like this spot a lot. They have a really thorough menu; tons of stuff from sushi to other traditional Japanese dishes like buckwheat noodles (yum), meat dishes and broths. You can eat real healthy here, too. I enjoyed the teriyaki-garlic chicken I had recently; they have three options for teriyaki sauces which is a really nice touch. I also thought their brown rice (for $1.50 extra) was well worth it - it's super thick and chewy and way healthy. 

I like restaurants where "there's something for everyone" and Ten-Ichi is def. that spot.
author: Meredith R.

description:
This is a God awful restaurant! Came for dinner on a Sunday night with a gf.  First, I ordered a green tea and was brought regular tea - when I enquired about my green tea, our waitress merely said, "This is the only tea we have..." Well, why didn't you say so earlier?

Then my friend ordered an Amstel Light and they brought an Anchor Steam.  I ordered a glass of water that came in a glass with a massive crack in it.  And that was before the food, right?

Next came the sushi rolls, as one reivewer wrote, the fish was a hack job - that's exactly it.  The rice was still warm and had too much vinegar in it.  The filling in the rolls were meagre and poorly rolled.  

All in all, I was pretty disgusted by this place and the whole dinner left my tummy not feeling well.  I would not step foot in here again, even if you paid me.
author: Favoloso M.

description:
If it were possible, I would leave no stars. This place had by far the worst service I've experienced in my life. After we were seated, no one spoke to us for 15 minutes. Finally they came to take our order.. 20 minutes later we received 1 salad- we ordered 2. We inquired about our food twice and 10 minutes later still nothing. Finally after this 45 minute horrible venture.. We decided to cut our losses and leave. They still charged us $30 for drinks- Which I thought was ridiculous. 
Save yourself a terrible night and go somewhere else
author: Brittany S.

description:
Okay food + okay service. I've only been there for lunch and I always get the lunch combo. 
Food comes out really slow and portions are okay.
author: Coco L.

description:
Pretty awesome family-run japanese place on Fillmore that seems to have decent vegetarian options!
Nice ambience.. pretty sparsely populated (on a sunday night), which was nice.
I got the vegetable saute with rice.. it was pretty bland, which is actually kinda nice. It comes with miso soup, which they replaced with a salad because I am vegetarian. Portions were pretty big and filling. Prices pretty low.
They seem to have quite a few vegetarian sushi options which all sound pretty yummy.. am definitely coming back here again!!
author: Aditya M.

description:
Definitely has the family owned vibe which is something I either really appreciate in a restaurant or despise. They seem to have their game together though I thought the prices were a tad bit higher than the should be. Overall mostly speedy service with an adorable young waitress that was helpful with recommendations. 
I had a volcano roll that had really excellent crispy skin for texture wrapped in avocado to lighten it up. Seaweed trio lacked vinegar, but easily alleviated if ordered in the beginning.  My 2 other friends went basic with chicken bowls, but after finishing the protein that was enough for them! Worth a second-look as others are stating happy hour always seems like the best bet for a sushi restaurant. 3 1/2 *'s
author: John P.

description: So good. Can't believe it. The sushi chef told us about all the rolls and then offered to make us something special. Can't wait til I come back again. Which will be soon.
author: Scott H.

description: One of the best sushi spots in SF and a well kept secret. Order the mushroom miso soup. Sashimi sake and spicy scallops are fantastic. Veggie tempura is also a fun change. Go to order is miso soup, green tea, sake and saba sashimi. If you are hungry then ask for the Francine.
author: Mark B.

description: All I ever get for lunch when I'm in the area due to work, is their Katsu Don. Sometimes, the cutlet is fried perfectly which adds to a mos-def crunchy experience. And then, you have the soggy cutlet which doesn't happen often luckily.  For some reason, I never order sashimi here.
author: Derek N.

description:
Best sushi in the neighborhood, top 5 in San Francisco.  
-fish is always fresh and plentiful selection from Japan, BC, etc. 
-chef is extra awesome and recommends amazing dishes not the menu 
-rolls are traditional and made with toro if u ask and no extra charge!
-never a wait...best kept secret yet, shhhh
author: Cheryl L.

description: fish was fresh. uni was smooth. The service is ok. Something is just too plain about this place especially being so close to Japan town.
author: Ivy R.

description: I don't mind spending money for good food or a lot of food but unfortunately this place had neither.  We figured we would give this place a shot since we wanted some appetizers.  We ordered 1 shrimp tempura small plate  and 1 chicken katsu dinner which had teriyaki sauce instead of katsu sauce and 1 order of crunchy sushi and were thoroughly disappointed with the flavor and the total bill.  We've definitely had way better tasting and quality food for the same price we paid here.   Using my husband's words..."don't do it".
author: La Verne C.

description:
Ten Ichi is down the street from the CPMC Pacific campus.  It's been there for over 30 years.  I've been there many times for lunch but not in the past ten years.  When asked where'd I like to go for Mom's Day, I chose Ten Ichi.  It had the best Chicken Kaarage around ,on the bone, lightly crisply fried with a sweet honey glaze.  Alas it is not the same.  Now it has a thicker batter and the sauce is a regular teriyaki sauce.
The tempura was oily.  I was very disappointed.  The secrets before were not handed down.

Another downfall was my daughter ordered the Nigiri dinner.  It took forever for it to come, along with two other sushi rolls.  We all got our hot food, but my daughter waited and waited.  We started eating ours so it wouldn't get cold.  The waitress
apologized many times and the owner did too.  He brought her a bowl of edamame
to hold her over.  H said the sushi chefs were backlogged.  Everybody was ordering sushi.  Well what do you expect in a Japanese restaurant?!!
When it finally came, I will say the sushi was very good!  Very tasty with fresh and unusual ingredients.

If anyone goes, just get the sushi, not the hot food, but hope that they get another chef to help.
I give Ten Ichi 3 stars for the past memories.
author: lori l.

description: I love there beef teriyake its cooked well, tasty, and tender.  Dont forget to ask for extra teriyake sauce. Usually my go to spot for japanese food near my work. It is a bit pricey.  Ive only had take out. Never really ate insdie since we have short lunch
author: Nahwal V.

description:
I used to go to this place a lot, 25 years ago when I was in professional school in the neighborhood. I liked it then because it was relatively cheap good Japanese food for lunch. Now that Fillmore Street has gone even more upscale, Ten Ichi has been remodeled. The menu has changed too. There seems to be more bias towards non-Japanese tastes. I've never seen a stir-fry over brown rice offered at an authentic Japanese restaurant. 

That being said, we were hungry for some sushi. And the sushi was decent. We had a variety of rolls and nigiri sushi, as well as a couple of hand rolls. The nigiri was ok. The fish portions could have been a bit bigger. The rolls were ok too. Nothing special. I did like the Hawaiian roll with the macadamia nuts and shiso leaf. The hand rolls were so so. They need to understand that when hand rolls should be served immediately while the nori is still crisp. By the time we got our hand rolls, the nori was mushy soft.

Service was a bit slow. It was late and only two servers were present. But overall the meal was decent.
author: James K.

description: Ok nice, decent food. Seemed family friendly people run the place but took awhile for them to seat us and only one other party in the place. They all just stood in back looking at entrance and at us. Took about three minutes before a young lady came up and seated us. Sat where we wanted. Food was good & priced fairly. Service was slow and a different person came to our table every step of the way. But, over all not too bad. Nothing to write home about or bring you back. Just ok
author: Dar G.

description: Very disappointing sushi - other than the service (which was friendly), there is absolutely no reason to 'spend' a meal at this restaurant...especially in a city that boasts such excellent Asian food!
author: Michel P.

description:
Came here on a Friday night.  Place was almost empty... that should've been a warning to flee.  Alas, we wanted sushi in the area and of the three to show up on Yelp mobile, it was the only Zagat-rated one.  

This is one step up from Safeway sushi.  Small, butchered cuts of sashimi bitch slapped on rice.  For sushi, they used real crab but not fresh crab.  For what they serve, they're charging $2-3 too much per item. 

Miso black cod is loaded with MSG, I was reaching for water and tea between bites.  Said water and tea weren't refilled.  I gave up waiting and drank all my water supply at home.  

Even at cheaper prices I wouldn't come back.
author: Erika C.

description:
I always love a friendly and talkative sushi chef. It makes me feel like I can ask those questions I've always wanted to ask. The gentleman behind the counter was friendly and informative, and most importantly, he served up some beautiful fish!

The $2 beer/edamame happy hour rules, and the firecracker hamachi nigiri is worth a return trip.
author: Ben R.

description:
When thinking of what to write about Ten-Ichi, the first thing that came to mind was "at least it was clean" (thus the two stars instead of one).

This place was extremely overpriced (i.e. more than twice the best sushi restaurant in Seattle), the rolls were not creative (in fact they were rather bland), and the fish wasn't great.

I wanted to like it (it would be wonderful to have a cute neighborhood sushi place), and I would even pay that price if the sushi was really stellar.. however I can't see any reason to return to this joint.
author: Helen D.

description:
3.5 stars. 

Service: decent
Price: a little overpriced, especially for lunch
Sushi: decent 
Udons : good, just slightly salty
Sukiyaki : overwhelmingly sweet
Dons: garlic chicken don is delicious ($10.95 for lunch)

I only go here because it's the closest sushi restaurant near my work.
author: linh d.

description: Sat at the sushi bar, best sushi I've had in SFO yet, and hands down the best Uni I've ever had.  Not sure what you guys with some of the lower reviews are ordering but I will certainly be back.  I was taken to dinner so no word on the price but wouldn't be surprised by the bill due the quality of the fish I had.
author: Drew Z.

description:
The service was fabulous! We requested a highchair with our reservation and they had it all set up (complete with a table cloth underneath should she make a mess while eating, haha! ) Plus we were seated right next to a fish tank - sweet! Perfect for the baby who may get bored sitting with a table full of adults. I think we met the manager or owner and he was super nice.
