The sushi is fresh and if when I can't decide what to eat, I sit at the sushi bar and the friendly chefs can make suggestions or create something unique for me to eat. I've eaten here several times now and can recommend almost everything on the menu from the agedashi tofu to the beef negimiyaki. They have the standard tempura, teriyaki dishes, and homestyle yummies like sukiyaki which are all delicious!  In addition though, their menu is imaginative and fun with things like their crunchy roll and tuna carpacio.  I also love their chicken karaage. Just remember with all this good stuff, to leave room for sushi!  Oh and if you wnjoy a cold brew of Kirin straight off the tap and into a frosted glass, this is the place to go!

This restaurant has been family owned for more than 25 years... you can often find the owner's around for a little chat. The service is friendly and the decor clean, pleasant and uncluttered. This is also a place great for children, who I've seen there many times... especially hanging around the beautiful fish tank.  I've taken many family and friends here and would have no problem recommending Ten Ichi to any lover of Japanese food.
author: Christine H.

description:
i love this place for dinner.
but you have to sit at the counter and talk to steve.
his parents own the place and he is really into making sushi, he creates his own rolls and nigiri.
happy hour is i think from 430 to 630, and you can get a beer and edamame for $2.
lunch time is good too, but you can't be in a hurry.
author: whitney c.

description:
Some friends tease me that, at times, I can be a sushi snob - I've been eating sushi for almost 30 years and have enjoyed some of the best sushi in NYC, LA, Tokyo, and Europe. So, when I recently moved to SF I was eager to test the local sushi scene. 

Ten-Ichi delivers a solid dining experience. The fish is fresh, the chefs and waitstaff are friendly, and the atmosphere is relaxed. Those who prefer "sushi as art" (i.e. Nobu in NYC) or who think that only the Japanese can do sushi right might quip that Ten-Ichi is too mainstream. But don't let that stop you, this place great and definitely worth a try.
author: Rob from Riga A.

description: Authentic japanese food with new contemporary dishes... family owned for 40 years... the fish are always fresh...  had amazing wild white salmon sashimi...  support staff delivers good service... from beginning to end it's always a wonderful meal...
author: William W.

description: I've eaten here probably 15-20 times. I would say that the sushi may not be exotic, but it is very tasty and the service excellent (especially the owner and her daughter have taken the time out to acknowledge my wife and me). The sushi chef there when we first started going was a very pleasant Japanese fellow who was working on his country western guitar playing. We like'd sitting at the bar drinking cold saki, (declasse'?) and enjoying the banter about us. The prices are not out of line with what you pay elsewhere, but parking sucks. Fillmore street is steadily getting more and more chi chi, so go before all the shops are too expensive. Remember the Hill Top Bar and the Persian fellow who ran the gelateria?
author: Craig M.

description: unfortunately a party of 6 is too much for this place.  i went on a monday night with friends, but was disappointed by our service.  we waited forever for our food, all the while thinking that they were preparing everything at once (we ordered a lot) but when it came out, we only got a portion of our sushi.  so then we had to wait for the rest to come out.  we would have been fine with receiving our sushi in waves, but not after waiting so long.  i thought our sushi was good, but not enough to go back and risk having to wait so long.  our waitress was very apologetic, which was nice though.
author: Carolyn B.

description: the fish here is so fresh!  i love the location too...  this part of fillmore is so adorable...the trees have fairy lights and there are great shops to check out as well!  good for a date or to go with friends.  for the quality of sushi, the price is really reasonable.  i have always had a good experience here, and have eaten here many many times.
author: Cel H.

description: Sushi is fantastic and their rolls are as delicious as they are inventive. Family owned and operated for over 30 years so you know that they are doing something right. People complain about the wait time but you cannot rush perfection so slow your "roll" people and enjoy. They have plenty to see and drink. Or have Steve or Ken make you something special or ask for the always amazing Carpaccio. Neighborhood couldn't be cuter so without a doubt, a place to put on your "to eat" in SF.
author: Jen W.

description: Tenichi is a neighborhood favorite and has been around forever.  They have great, fresh sushi, excellent udon, and my mother loves their sukiyaki.  Their small green salad (not to be confused with the garden salad) is famous amongst people in the know. They've added a menu of specials that is a little more adventurous and "fusion" style.  I'm surprised people have negative things to say about this place.  The service is great- the only negative I can think of is if you sit near the door it can get a little cold with the door opening and closing frequently.  So just sit in the back!
author: Lindsey C.

description: This place was absolutely terrible. My spicy tuna roll was full of rice and no fish. The best part of the night was when we got Andes chocolates with the bill.
author: Barrie A.

description: Had a sushi snob friend in town visiting  (he's earned the right after living in Tokyo for a while) and he says to me "I'm only going out for sushi if it's good sushi" so, of course, I take him to Ten-Ichi.  Top points awarded by him for having Sapporo on draught poured cold & clean, and top points from me for their deliciously fresh uni, Alaskan salmon and ikura. YUM!  Can't wait to go back.
author: Melissa H.

description: this was my first sushi place and I have been a fan of Ten-ichi for 20years!! -and I love the location on Fillmore, go before a show, you'll thank me.
author: stephanie r.

description: my friend and i stopped in at the sushi bar here in the midst of our quest to hunt down a dj and his guitar, and were pleasantly surprised to find that the sushi we ordered was excellent and cheap!  it was one of those places that makes you remember what really good sushi tastes like.  i'm only holding back a star because we were only able to taste a few things and i'd like to go back and investigate further.  (and don't worry, we got the guitar!  all at ten-ichi ...)
author: ali l.

description: I've been to Te-Ichi two times, and both times the sushi has been fantastic.  The rolls are creative and new, without being over the top and doused in sauce.  The nigiri is fresh and tasty.  In particular, I really enjoyed the blue fin tuna special.  All in all, this place is affordable and tasty.
author: Patrick P.

description: yummy but pricey.  very nice surprise close to home.   we did have an issue with another diner not liking our groups discussion (but hey we were a group of 6...can't expect us to eat in silence).
author: Jolsna J.

description: Ten-Ichi is a great neighborhood sushi joint. My husband and I was visiting my cousin in the area and she suggested we go there. It was within walking distance from her apartment. We were a group of 4 and decided to sit at the sushi bar so we can order directly from the chef. We just asked the chef to recommned whatever is good and fresh. It was tasty. As a custom in Japan, we will ask the sushi chef to drink with us when the food is great. They reluntantly took a few drinks from us. haha~ Everyone was friendly, from the chefs, to the owner, and his wife. That was great food and great fun. I love the no pressure atmoshphere and the friendly staff.  I think we ordered two bottles of cold sake. Ordered a bunch of sashimi and rolls. An order of hamachi kama, and a bunch of stuff I can't remember now.  And the miso soup was better than usual. We're going to go there again for my husband's birthday next month.
author: megumi m.

description: We ordered the philly and california rolls which were fine.  We also ordered the noodle salad which was good.  We had the beef appetizer which was too chewy and the asparagus was not that great.  The total bill was $30.
author: Brian L.

description: Best sushi.  Always fresh and yummy!  Also the sushi chef Jonny is the best.  Sit at the bar and buy him a beer.  He will steer you in the direction of wonderful unique dishes made just for you.  The service is top notch and the fish, still jumping ;-)
author: amy c.

description: the sushi was delicious, but the place was too crowded.  If you want to indulge, you need to ger there early or late.
author: melissa W.

description: This place was TERRIBLE when I went. The portions were pathetically small, the food was all over-priced, and the SERVICE was HORRIBLE. Everyone sitting around me was complaining about the service. They were slow, it took 20 mins to get a beer, and they were snappy. I will never eat here again.
author: lady l.

description: this is our favorite sushi place in the city.  i'd have to say it's because of the combination of things rather than anything in particular.  it's easy to get seated, the sushi is excellent, the prices are good, the service is very good and the energy is somehow just perfect.  i don't find many sushi places with great ambiance.  mostly too bright or too small.  ten-ichi is just right.  good lighting, pretty mellow and just a great place to relax and eat, drink and have a good time
author: ed d.
